meanings.definition: Of or relating to the act of exerting force or effort.
meanings.sent1: She displayed an exertive attitude during the challenging workout.
meanings.sent2: The exertive strength of the weightlifter impressed everyone.
meanings.sent3: His exertive determination to finish the race made his friends cheer him on.
meanings.sent4: The exertive energy of the storm was felt throughout the town.
meanings.sent5: The exertive effort she put into her studies paid off with excellent grades.

meanings.definition: Showing the ability to exert influence or control.
meanings.sent1: The leader's exertive presence commanded attention in the room.
meanings.sent2: Her exertive leadership style inspired her team to work harder.
meanings.sent3: The cat's exertive behavior towards the dog was amusing to watch.
meanings.sent4: His exertive influence over the group was undeniable.
meanings.sent5: The exertive control she had over the situation prevented chaos.

meanings.definition: The act of putting forth physical or mental effort.
meanings.sent1: His exertive in the gym led to noticeable muscle growth.
meanings.sent2: The exertive she put into her studies resulted in academic success.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's exertive to make people laugh was evident in his jokes.
meanings.sent4: Her exertive in the kitchen produced a delicious meal for her family.
meanings.sent5: The exertive of the hikers to reach the mountain peak was inspiring to others.
